articles.author: JEFF AMY
articles.description: ATLANTA (AP) — Many questions in last week's Georgia school shooting are still unanswered, including how the suspect brought a semiautomatic assault rifle to the campus of Apalachee High School and what may have motivated the violence.
articles.title: Many questions still loom over timeline of Georgia school shooting

articles.author: MARK KENNEDY
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — James Earl Jones, who overcame racial prejudice and a severe stutter to become a celebrated icon of stage and screen — eventually lending his deep, commanding voice to CNN, “The Lion King” and Darth Vader — has died.
articles.title: James Earl Jones, acclaimed actor and voice of Darth Vader, dies at 93

articles.author: BILL BARROW
articles.description: ATLANTA (AP) — From her earliest campaigns in California to her serving as President Joe Biden's running mate, Kamala Harris has honed an aggressive but calibrated approach to debates.
articles.title: Harris' past debates: A prosecutor's style with narrative flair but risks in a matchup with Trump

articles.author: JILL COLVIN
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — He claimed she would raise taxes and accused her of supporting open border policies that would allow an influx of unvetted migrants into the country. He blamed her for a litany of the current administration's failures and cast her potential presidency as four more years of the same.
articles.title: What the Trump-Clinton debates might tell us about Tuesday's match with Harris

articles.author: BRUCE SCHREINER and DYLAN LOVAN
articles.description: LONDON, Ky. (AP) — The man suspected of opening fire on a highway in Kentucky sent a text message vowing to “kill a lot of people” less than 30 minutes before he shot and wounded five people on Interstate 75, authorities said in an arrest warrant.
articles.title: Man accused of shooting 5 on Kentucky interstate vowed to 'kill a lot of people,' warrant says

articles.author: MICHAEL LIEDTKE
articles.description: CUPERTINO, Calif. (AP) — Apple on Monday charged into the artificial intelligence craze with a new iPhone lineup that marks the company’s latest attempt to latch onto a technology trend and transform it into a cultural phenomenon.
articles.title: Apple embraces the AI craze with its newly unleashed iPhone 16 lineup

articles.author: ALANIS THAMES
articles.description: MIAMI GARDENS, Fla. (AP) — The president of South Florida's police union said Miami Dolphins receiver Tyreek Hill was handcuffed and placed face down on the ground during a traffic stop because he was not “immediately cooperative” with officers, but Hill said he was respectful throughout the interaction.
articles.title: Tyreek Hill says he was respectful during traffic stop but police union says he wasn't 'cooperative'

articles.author: DANICA KIRKA
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — Kate, the princess of Wales, has completed chemotherapy and will make a limited number of public appearances in the coming months, bolstering Britain’s royal family after it was rocked by the twin cancer diagnoses of the princess and King Charles III.
articles.title: Kate, princess of Wales, says she completed chemotherapy and will return to limited public duties

articles.author: IMAD ISSIED
articles.description: NABLUS, West Bank (AP) — The Palestinian Authority held a funeral procession Monday for an American activist who a witness says was shot and killed by Israeli forces last week following a demonstration against settlements in the occupied West Bank.
articles.title: Funeral held for an American activist a witness says was shot dead by Israeli troops

articles.author: SARA CLINE and JAMIE STENGLE
articles.description: BATON ROUGE, La. (AP) — Tropical Storm Francine strengthened Monday in the Gulf of Mexico and was forecast to make landfall as a hurricane this week in Louisiana, where evacuation orders were quickly issued in some coastal communities and residents began filling sandbags in preparation for heavy rains and widespread flooding.
articles.title: Louisiana residents brace as Tropical Storm Francine is expected to hit their coast as a hurricane
